quote: It’s a damn poor mind that can only think of one way to spell a word.
author: Andrew Jackson

quote: I never met a man so stupid I could not learn something from him.
author: Galileo Galilei

quote: For myself, I am an optimist — it does not seem to be much use being anything else.
author: Winston Churchill

quote: Men are born ignorant, not stupid. They are made stupid by education.
author: Bertrand Russell

quote: Always forgive your enemies; nothing annoys them so much.
author: Oscar Wilde

quote: Believe those who are seeking the truth; doubt those who find it.
author: André Gide

quote: Honest differences are often a healthy sign of progress.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: Life can only be understood backwards; but it must be lived forwards.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quote: The silence often of pure innocence persuades when speaking fails.
author: William Shakespeare

quote: We don’t see things as they are, we see things as we are.
author: Anaïs Nin
